comment.body:
I've been thinking about it as well. FI_HMEM set to the empty string could be used to say 'do not initialize anything' or just enable FI_HMEM_SYSTEM.

I think an empty setting should be treated as FI_HMEM_SYSTEM. I cannot conceive of a use case where FI_HMEM_SYSTEM shouldn't be available.

pull_request.title: core: Add restricted dlopen flag to configure options
pull_request.body:
This commit introduces a new flag, --enable-restricted-dl. By default, restricted_dl is false, which continues the existing behavior of fi_getinfo. The current behavior of fi_getinfo causes the library to probe all paths in LD_LIBRARY_PATH for all possible provider implementations known by ofi_ordered_provs_init, or in cases where FI_PROVIDER_PATH is defined, a search along a colon-delimited set of paths for any library named lib*-fi.so. A side-effect of the non-FI_PROVIDER_PATH option is that a vast majority of the providers in the ofi_ordered_provs_init list, ordered_prov_names, will not exist on most systems. Usually a small subset of the providers exist, and the rest will not be present. A significant number of metadata fetches to the network filesystem will fail to find the desired library via dlopen incurring significant penalties during job launch at scale. As an application scales to larger rank and node counts, the impact by this behavior is expected to grow linearly, and then exponentially as the network file system metadata servers are overwhelmed.

This impact of dlopen misses can be largely mitigated with the use of FI_PROVIDER_PATH, but that eliminates the ability to naturally load DL libraries through dlopen's search capability unless the admin or workload manager specify possible paths for each known set of DL provider implementations.

This commit seeks to find a solution in the middle -- dlopen capability and natural discovery of DL providers without searching for every possible provider and no prerequisite knowledge of the available DL providers in the workload manager or module environments.

When enabled, ofi_ordered_provs_init will seed the initial prov_head with providers that satisfy the following conditions:
- The provider has been built into the library (detected at compile-time without --enable-only, or --enable-<provider>[=yes])
- The provider has been built standalone as a DL provider (--enable-<provider>=dl)
- The provider exists in the 'ordered_load_list' in ofi_ordered_provs_init.

Providers that do not meet the above conditions will not be loaded by libfabric if --enable-restricted-dl is provided to configure.

A similar feature will be required for HMEM provider solutions. Vendors may need to compile support for GPU libraries, but customers of the vendor may not use one or more of the supported GPU libraries.

pull_request.title: prov/verbs: Add synapseai dmabuf mr support
pull_request.body:
The following changes were made to enable Gaudi-direct support over libfabric verbs provider, to allow peer-to-peer communication using dmabuf mr. They are applicble to device memory with iface value of FI_HMEM_SYNAPSEAI:
* Add function for dmabuf registration with synapseai.
* Use rndv protocol for rxm msg send to avoid copy between host and device memory.

issue.title: src/hmem: Only initalize synapseai if device exists
issue.body: Synapseai currently initializes successfully if libraries are installed. Make synapseai only claim to be initialized if libraries are installed and a device exists.

comment.body: Tested on dl1 and this seems to be working.

issue.title: Support Multiple Authorization Keys per Endpoint
issue.body:
Formal PR from https://github.com/ofiwg/libfabric/pull/9319.

Use-case described in https://github.com/ofiwg/libfabric/discussions/9204.

issue.title: Update util CQ code to support err_data
issue.body: The CXI provider uses the util CQ code. When implementing FI_SOURCE_ERR, it was discovered that the util CQ code does not properly support err_data. This PR updates/fixes the util CQ code to support this..

commits.message:
Updated nroff-generated man pages

Signed-off-by: OFIWG Bot <ofiwg@lists.openfabrics.org>

Merge pull request #9478 from ofiwg/pr/update-nroff-generated-man-pages-main

Update nroff-generated man pages

pull_request.title: Support for max_ep_auth_key
pull_request.body:
Since both of this changes require ABI updates, I decided to include them in the same PR. If it is easier to have these changes in separate PRs, I can separate it out.

Update: the optional_caps changes have been removed.

commits.message:
core: Define fi_domain_attr::max_ep_auth_key

max_ep_auth_key is used by providers to report the number of
authorization keys supported per connectionless endpoint. This is
required to support FI_AV_AUTH_KEY in future commits.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

man: Doc max_ep_auth_key

This is used by providers to report the number of authorization keys per
connectionless endpoint.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

util: Add domain checks for max_ep_auth_key

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

util: Alter domain max_ep_auth_key

Update returned domain_attr max_ep_auth_key to reflect user provider
max_ep_auth_key hint. User input has already been verified by this
point.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

core: Convert old fi_info to latest def

fi_dupinfo() for ABI 1.1 and 1.2 was only converting fi_info and none of
the other attr structs inside fi_info. This can lead to current
definition of fi_dupinfo() to read in garbage data from previous struct
definitions. To prevent this dup and convert the all old fi_info and
attrs to the latest definition. Any new fields will be zeroed.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

core: 1.7 ABI compat

ABI version is updated to 1.7 to accommodate
fi_domain_attr::max_ep_auth_key_cnt.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

man: Doc ABI 1.7

ABI 1.7 adds fi_domain_attr::max_ep_auth_key and optional_caps.

Signed-off-by: Ian Ziemba <ian.ziemba@hpe.com>

pull_request.title: hmem: remove cuda-specific functions when using `ofi_hmem_dev_reg_*`
pull_request.body:
remove cuda-specific naming and functions when using `ofi_hmem_dev_reg_*` function family
- [x] removes the need to check for `cuda_is_gdrcopy_enabled()`: `ofi_hmem_dev_register` fails if GDR copy is not available
- [x] update the bit mask to remove reference to cuda
- [x] ~update the EFA provider accordingly (@wenduwan do you want to do it here or in another PR?)~
